newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: DRUG SQUAD RAIDS MARADONA'S BOCA AND SOCCER BODY.
newsitem.headline: DRUG SQUAD RAIDS MARADONA'S BOCA AND SOCCER BODY.

text.p: An Argentine police drug squad on Wednesday raided Diego Maradona's club Boca Juniors, the Argentina Football Association and a sports training centre where routine soccer match drug tests are examined.
Boca spokesman Ivan Pavlovsky told reporters at the Buenos Aires grounds of Argentina's most famous club that police "asked for players' dope-test records and took them away."

He said they were interested in the records of tests done two months ago on Maradona -- who admits he takes drugs and was banned for 15 months for failing a drugs test at the U.S. World Cup -- and Deportivo Espanol player Martin Vargas.
The test on Maradona, who recently spent 10 days at a Swiss drugs clinic to try to beat the habit, was negative. The test on Vargas was positive.

The result caused an outcry in the sports press with Dr. Americo Ecuardo Ciarrochi, pushing a new dope law through Congress, asking in the sports newspaper El Grafico: "How can it be that Vargas' test is positive while that of Maradona, who recognises he is an addict, does not?"
AFA Chairman Julio Grondona, taken by surprise by the raid, told reporters police could "take whatever they want, from the basement to the top floor where the caretaker lives."
